intro: Knowltonia pulsatilloides, commonly known as the pink morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, pale pink to purple flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and twining stems that climb or trail along the ground. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
